meanings.definition: To crush or flatten with a steamroller.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers steamrollered the road to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The steamrollered pavement was now perfectly flat.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally steamrollered my sandwich while trying to pack my lunch.
meanings.sent4: Her powerful voice steamrollered through the noise of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The giant machine steamrollered everything in its path, leaving no bumps behind.

meanings.sent1: The loud music steamrollered my ability to concentrate on my homework.
meanings.sent2: The team steamrollered their opponents in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The toddler steamrollered his way through the toy store, grabbing everything in sight.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter steamrollered any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sudden news steamrollered her emotions, leaving her speechless.

meanings.sent1: The determined athlete steamrollered towards the finish line, leaving competitors behind.
meanings.sent2: The project steamrollered ahead despite initial setbacks.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic puppy steamrollered into the room, wagging its tail furiously.
meanings.sent4: His charisma steamrollered through the doubts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The storm steamrollered through the town, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake.
